page.title: 06FRANK PRICE LOCK
page.content: The{Frank Price Lock}was re_opened in 1983. It is 72 metres long, 7 metres wide and 8 metres deep. The lock is operated by a{computer}in the{control {tower.}To open the lock gates there is a button which also operates the {hydraulic sluice gates.}To make the water level with the river you open the sluice gates, which let water in from the{canal.}When the water is level the lock gates are open and the barge can go in. In case of a power cut the lockeeper, Mr Lidster, has a generator which will make electricity to operate the lock. The lock has {traffic lights}on each side to tell the bargee when to sail into the lock. The lock gates have to be{'v' shaped.} If they are not the water would break through with all the{pressure.}The lock can take a{700 tonne barge. }
